articles.title: Greetings to Chairman of Commission of African Union
articles.content:
Greetings to Chairman of Commission of African Union
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Nkosazana Dlamini-Zuma, chairman of the Commission of the African Union, on the Day of Africa.
					 The message said the Korean people wish the African people successes in their efforts to accomplish political and economic integration of the continent, consolidate peace and stability and achieve independent development and prosperity. It expressed belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and the African Union and its member countries would grow stronger,

articles.title: Greetings to Jordanian King
articles.content:
Greetings to Jordanian King
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Monday sent a message of greeting to Abdullah Ⅱ, king of Jordan, on the occasion of the 69th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message wished the king good health and happiness and the king and people of Jordan greater successes in their work to achieve stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Vietnamese Party Delegation
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Vietnamese Party Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with a delegation of the Communist Party of Vietnam headed by Le Huu Nghia, vice-chairman of the Central Theory Council of the party, which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Vietnamese Party Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Vietnamese Party Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of the Communist Party of Vietnam.
					 The gift was handed to Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Monday by Le Huu Nghia, vice-chairman of the Central Theory Council of the party who is heading the delegation.

articles.title: Vietnamese Party Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Vietnamese Party Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Communist Party of Vietnam headed by Le Huu Nghia, vice-chairman of the Central Theory Council of the party, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President, the guests looked round historical relics preserved at the old home in Mangyongdae. 
					
					 The delegation also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Arch of Triumph, the Rungna Dolphinarium, the Munsu Water Park and other places.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Here
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Academy of Social Science of Vietnam headed by Vice-President Vo Khanh Vinh arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Here
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia headed by Ivan Abramov, member of the Regional Policy and Northern and Far Eastern Affairs Committee of the State Duma of the Russian Federation, arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Military Band of KPA Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
Military Band of KPA Leaves for Russia
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- The Military Band of the Korean People's Army (KPA) led by Senior Colonel Nam Chol left here on Monday to take part in the 4th International Military Music Festival "Waves of River Amur" among countries in the Asia-Pacific region to be held in Khabarovsk, Russia.

articles.title: DPRK Public Health Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Public Health Delegation Back Home 
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- A DPRK public health delegation led by Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health, returned home on Monday after participating in the 68th General Assembly of WHO held in Geneva.

articles.title: Delegation of Center for Energy and Security Studies of Russia Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Center for Energy and Security Studies of Russia Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Center for Energy and Security Studies of Russia headed by Director Anton Khlopkov left here for home on Monday.

articles.title: Oman FM Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Oman FM Delegation Arrives 
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Oman led by Vice-Minister Ahmed Bin Yosif Obaid Al Harthi arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: DPRK Team Wins at Regional Soccer Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Team Wins at Regional Soccer Championship
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team came first at the 2015 AFC U-14 Girl Regional Championship (East Asia).
					 The championship held in China from May 19 brought together teams from 8 countries including the DPRK and Taipei of China. It was divided into two groups for league matches. 
					
					 The DPRK team belonging to Group B won overwhelming victory over its rivals China, Hong Kong of China and Northern Mariana Islands. It humbled its Japanese rival 3:0 in the semifinals.
					
					 It trounced its Chinese rival 2:0 in the finals on Sunday.

articles.title: Cooperation with UNICEF Proves Successful in DPRK
articles.content:
Cooperation with UNICEF Proves Successful in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is expanding cooperation with the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) in improving children's health and their education.
					 According to an official concerned, it has been brisk in the DPRK to promote health of children under five in close cooperation with UNICEF.
					
					 As part of the cooperation, all the children across the country should have to be normally inoculated against diseases like polio, measles and tuberculosis. And childcare facilities in different parts of the country have been supplied with nutrients, including F75, F100, iodine pills and vitamin A, on a regular basis.
					
					 Gravity-fed waterworks have been completed in many areas of South Hamgyong, South Hwanghae and North Phyongan provinces.
					
					 The cooperation between the DPRK and UNICEF has brought about good results in improving preschool education and educational environment.
					
					 The DPRK joined UNICEF on May 25, 1985.

articles.title: DPRK Strives to Preserve Water Resources
articles.content:
DPRK Strives to Preserve Water Resources
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea is now striving to preserve the water resources.
					 According to Kim Kwang Min, department director of the Ministry of Urban Management, big efforts have been directed to protecting the water resources and preventing water pollution.
					
					 A plan for developing water resources in an overall and rational way was worked out and practical measures were taken for the most effective use of water and control of its quality.
					
					 Gravity-fed drinking water service system was established in Sinhung, Yonggwang and many other counties. And purification plants in Pyongyang and other parts of the country were equipped with advanced facilities to improve the water quality.
					
					 Meanwhile, a work goes on at hydro-power stations across the country to store water as much as possible.
					
					 Also, efforts are concentrated on the technological development for putting the use of water resources, prevention of water pollution, sewage disposal and water environmental control on an IT basis.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Foreigners and overseas compatriots visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio on Monday. They included a delegation of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, a delegation of the Omani Foreign Ministry and members of delegations to take part in the 2015 briefing on investment in Wonsan-Mt. Kumgang international tourist zone.
					 They laid bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Commemorative Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
Commemorative Stamp Issued in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- A stamp (one sheet) was issued in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to mark the 60th anniversary of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 Seen on its upper part are letters reading "In commemoration of the 60th anniversary of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan" and "Juche 44 (1955)-Juche 104 (2015)".
					
					 The sheet carries a photo of President Kim Il Sung meeting with Chairman of the Central Standing Committee Han Tok Su and other senior officials of Chongryon against the background of the DPRK's flag.
					
					 It also displays the teachings of Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK, that the Chongryon officials and Korean residents in Japan should reliably defend the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's idea on the Juche-based overseas compatriots' movement and their undying feats and deal with all affairs of Chongryon as intended and desired by them.
					
					 Chongryon is a legitimate overseas citizens' organization of the DPRK founded by Kim Il Sung on May 25, Juche 44 (1955).

articles.title: 60th Anniversary of Chongryon Marked
articles.content:
60th Anniversary of Chongryon Marked
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday dedicates an editorial to the 60th anniversary of the formation of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 The six decade-long history of Chongryon is the one of shining victory of the idea of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu for the development of the Juche-oriented overseas compatriots' movement and their outstanding leadership over it, the editorial says, adding: 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung was the founder and leader of Chongryon who set forth an original idea and theory on the overseas compatriots' movement and successfully steered the Juche-oriented overseas compatriots' movement. 
					
					 As Chongryon was formed on May 25, Juche 44 (1955) under the leadership of the President, the Koreans in Japan could have a true organization representing their rights and interests and lead a worthwhile life on the patriotic road with honor and dignity as overseas citizens of the DPRK.
					
					 The guidance of leader Kim Jong Il provided a firm guarantee for steadily developing the patriotic cause of Chongryon along the road of Juche.
					
					He clarified intense loyalty to the President as the main orientation of
					
					work of Chongryon with his outstanding wisdom and foresight in the
					
					1960s. He led Chongryon to develop into an overseas compatriots'
					
					organization, boundlessly true to the idea and leadership of the President.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un provided important guidelines for developing the movement of Koreans in Japan on a new high stage in the period of historic turn in carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche and is adding shine to the history of loving care of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Advantages of Korean-style Socialism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Advantages of Korean-style Socialism
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- The Korean-style socialist system is like a flower garden of love for human beings and a permanent cradle of happiness as it provides the people with the most worthwhile life, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 In the socialist society of the DPRK where the people are masters and everybody takes part in the exercise of all sovereign rights and the management of state affairs with equal political right.
					
					 Ordinary workers, farmers and intellectuals are elected deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly to discuss political affairs of the country. Working people are glorifying their political integrity while being affiliated with political organizations including political parties and working people's organizations. This is the true picture of Korean-style socialism.
					
					 In the DPRK which regards people as the most precious beings, human rights are guaranteed by law and even the slightest act of encroaching upon them is never allowed.
					
					 The Korean people benefit from free healthcare and free education enforced by the state and are free from all taxes after taxation was abolished.
					
					 The state is taking care of orphans and the old people without supporters in a responsible manner. It has become a social trait to preferentially treat the honored disabled soldiers and persons of meritorious services.
					
					 All the members of the society are firmly united in thinking and purpose thanks to warm comradeship.
					
					 Everything is done for the people and every issue is settled in reliance upon them. Herein lie the undisputable advantages and might of Korean-style socialism hardly imaginable under capitalism.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Diplomatic Chief's Call for Closer Cooperation with U.S.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Diplomatic Chief's Call for Closer Cooperation with U.S.
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Yun Pyong Se, puppet minister of Foreign Affairs of south Korea, in talks with U.S. Secretary of State Kerry held in Seoul on May 18 cried out for boosting "cooperation in the campaign against the north and joint deterrence", describing the DPRK's successful test-fire of ballistic missile from a strategic submarine as a "missile threat" and asserting the need to "pressurize the north to dismantle its nukes." At a press conference held at the end of the talks, they blustered that "pressure upon the north should be increased to lead it to changes" and raised a hue and cry over "human rights abuses" by someone.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK consider such invectives made by hostile forces as no more than a shriek of those much upset by the ever-growing might of Songun Korea.
					
					 The group of traitors, bereft of even an iota of self-respect, dares try to provoke the DPRK, making bluffing, backed by its American master. This is as foolish an act as trying to sweep the sea with a broom.
					
					 The DPRK will never allow anyone to infringe its dignity and sovereignty.
					
					 As proved by the above-said successful test-fire the DPRK is fully capable of striking and wiping out enemies at a single blow no matter where they are.
					
					 In the event of the final decisive battle the DPRK will give full play to its tremendous military muscle and mercilessly wipe out the U.S. and the puppet warmongers and successfully accomplish the historic cause of national reunification.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps Japanese Ruling Forces' Militarist Ambition for Reinvasion
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps Japanese Ruling Forces' Militarist Ambition for Reinvasion
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the present Cabinet of Japan approved a draft amendment to the security law which allowed the "Self-Defence Forces"(SDF) to expand the sphere of its activities abroad.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is an anachronistic move of those obsessed with militarist ambition for reinvasion.
					
					 It is nonsensical for Japan to talk about "global peace" as it has inglorious past and is blinded with militarist ambition for reinvasion.
					
					 The Japanese ruling forces are making much fuss, creating impression that they were requested by the world to make a contribution to global peace. This is nothing but a cynical ploy to openly launch aggression under the pretext of ensuring "peace".
					
					 It was hypocritical for the chief executive of Japan to have uttered that it would not be involved in a war.
					
					 The revised "Japan-U.S. Defence Cooperation Guidelines" make it possible for the SDF to conduct military activities overseas any time for "cooperation" with the U.S. forces.
					
					 Moreover, when the draft amendment to the security law is adopted as a formal law, Japan will turn into a military giant and the integration of military operations between Japan and the U.S. will make more rapid progress.
					
					 And Japan will excessively exercise the "right to collective self-defense" which has been banned so far.
					
					 Japan's exercise of the "right to collective self-defense" precisely means a war. Japanese will find no alternative but to take part in war whether they like or not.
					
					 If Japan is allowed to go on as now, it is bound to go to ruin and will not be able to escape the same shame as what it suffered during World War II.
					
					 If the present ruling forces of Japan have even an iota of reasonable thinking, they should roll back their militarist policy at once.
					
					 This is the only way of saving Japan from total destruction.

articles.title: U.S. Moves to Deploy THAAD Denounced by S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
U.S. Moves to Deploy THAAD Denounced by S. Korean Organization
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held a peace meeting before the U.S. military base in Ryongsan on May 21, denouncing the U.S. for forcing the deployment of THAAD in south Korea.
					 The participants said that the U.S. is pressurizing the "government" to deploy THAAD in south Korea.
					
					 They went on:
					
					 High-ranking officials of the U.S., including the secretary of State, talk about the need of the deployment of THAAD, citing the north's "nuclear and missile threats".
					
					 But this is sheer sophism to conceal the fact that the deployment is part of the MD system in Northeast Asia.
					
					 The deployment of THAAD will cause contradiction among the neighboring countries, creating big difficulties in the way of settling the issue of peaceful reunification on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The participants waged a demonstration, chanting the slogan "No THAAD".

articles.title: S. Korean Human Rights Committee Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Human Rights Committee Denounced 
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- The Joint Conference of Civic and Public Organizations of south Korea held a press conference before the building of the puppet Human Rights Committee on May 19 to denounce it for patronizing and conniving at human rights abuses by use of power.
					 The organization laid bare the fact that the committee openly patronized and connived at the puppet authorities' suppression.
					
					 It demanded disqualified persons who read face of power resign.

articles.title: Epidemic Spreads in S. Korea
articles.content:
Epidemic Spreads in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- An old man infected with the serious feverish thrombopenia syndrome, the epidemic spread by wild tick, was reported from South Chungchong Province, south Korea on May 9, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 The mortality rate is so high that 55 people were infected with the epidemic last year and 15 of them died.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Accuses Authorities
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Accuses Authorities
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hanguk Ilbo on May 22 in an editorial accused the puppet government of being dragged by the U.S. and Japan.
					 The editorial recalled that the Ministry of Defense announced that there would be talks between the defense ministers of Japan and south Korea on the sidelines of the 14th Asia Security Conference expected to take place between coming May 29 and 31 and the plan to hold talks with the U.S. is in the process of final coordination.
					
					 It noted that the Ministry of Defense said that a proposal for cooperation in the action to cope with "nuclear and missile threats from the north" and a plan for cooperation in the field of national defense would be discussed at the talks.
					
					 These talks will provide chances for boosting the system of military cooperation among the U.S., Japan and south Korea, it held, and continued:
					
					 South Korea is being dragged into the cooperation system to be led by the U.S. and Japan.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Yielding to U.S. Pressure for Deployment of THAAD
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Yielding to U.S. Pressure for Deployment of THAAD 
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society of south Korea on May 21 issued a commentary denouncing the puppet authorities for yielding to the U.S. pressure for deployment of THAAD.
					 The commentary noted that U.S. high-ranking officials have become all the more undisguised in talking about the deployment of THAAD in south Korea, but the south Korean authorities claimed that they neither officially negotiated nor discussed it.
					
					 The U.S. peddling of the issue of deploying THAAD is little short of building a regional missile shield together with Japan, the commentary noted.
					
					 It urged the authorities to oppose the deployment of THAAD.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Urges "Government" to Stand against U.S. THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Urges "Government" to Stand against U.S. THAAD Deployment 
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Kyunghyang Daily News on May 22 carried an editorial accusing the "government" of yielding to the U.S. pressure for the deployment of THAAD.
					 The editorial chided the U.S. secretary of State for talking about the deployment of THAAD under the pretext of the "north's threat".
					
					 It accused a spokesman for the Ministry of Defense of blustering that it was the principle of the "government" to naturally discuss the matter if the U.S. requests to do so.
					
					 This means the authorities' attitude of deceiving the people and, furthermore, disturbing peace on the Korean peninsula and stability in Northeast Asia, it held.
					
					 The editorial urged the south Korean authorities to clarify the stand of opposing the deployment of THAAD.

articles.title: Japanese Ultra-right Political Gangster's Shameless Terrorist Act Touches off Koreans' Indignation
articles.content:
Japanese Ultra-right Political Gangster's Shameless Terrorist Act Touches off Koreans' Indignation
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- A Japanese ultra-right political gangster committed a terrorist act of insulting the victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and justifying Japan's bid to grab Tok Islets on May 19, according to south Korean Kyunghyang Daily News.
					 The gangster who committed the shameless and mean acts has already been prosecuted without restraint on the suspicion of defamation as he tied a pile with letters Tok Islets belong to Japan on it around the sculpture of a girl sexual slave outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul in June 2012.
					
					 Moreover, he is under suspicion of planting a similar pile around the monument to the memory of Yun Pong Gil who threw a hand grenade to Japan high-ranking military officials in protest against the Japanese imperialists' occupation of Korea, creating a big stir inside and outside Korea.
					
					 The hysteric fits of Japanese gangsters are getting further undisguised under the patronage of the Japanese government and this sparks off greater indignation of the Koreans.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Pay Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Pay Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Japan staying in the socialist homeland visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio Monday on the occasion of the 60th founding anniversary of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon). They included a group of Koreans in Japan for expressing thanks to the homeland on the 60th anniversary of Chongryon led by Pae Ik Ju, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, and a delegation of veteran officials of Chongryon led by Pak Jong Sang, adviser to the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Writers and Artists in Japan.
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Polish Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted on Polish Website
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "To Protect National Heritage Is a Patriotic Undertaking for Adding Brilliance to the History and Traditions of Our Nation" was posted on the Polish website "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea" on May 19.
					 The work, published on October 24, Juche 103 (2014), recalls that President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il attached importance to the work for protecting national heritage and made efforts to glorify the long history and brilliant culture of the Korean nation in the whole period of their revolutionary leadership.
					
					 It also indicates tasks for preserving the immortal exploits performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and further glorifying the history and traditions of the Korean nation by thoroughly carrying out the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea on protecting the national heritage.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Highly Praised by Political Figure of Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Highly Praised by Political Figure of Kyrgyzstan
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgys El" Republican Political Party of Kyrgyzstan, released a statement on May 19 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 He said:
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the WPK, started his work at the Party Central Committee on June 19, 1964.
					
					 He developed in depth the Juche idea which was founded by President Kim Il Sung, father of socialist Korea, and glorified it as a guiding idea in the era of independence through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities.
					
					 He resolutely frustrated the moves of the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces, holding higher the banner of Songun when socialism collapsed in several countries at the end of the past century and the enemies ran amuck to stifle socialist Korea.
					
					 He is the great sun as he authored a lot of famous works, clearly indicating the way for progressive mankind to follow.

articles.title: Russian Papers Introduce DPRK
articles.content:
Russian Papers Introduce DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Russian papers gave publicity to the DPRK.
					 Rossiskaya Gazeta on May 12 carried an article of its correspondent illustrated with a photo of the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill and more than 40 other photos showing monumental edifices and true picture of Pyongyang.
					
					 The article said the correspondent witnessed for himself realities of the DPRK as a lot of misinformation about it was afloat these days.
					
					 The appearance of the capital city of the DPRK, land of Juche, has undergone a dramatic change as new apartment houses and recreation grounds are now under construction in different places. 
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un is paying great attention to the work and living of scientists.
					
					 The Munsu Water Park, the People's Open-air Ice Rink and many other facilities for cultural amenities sprang up in Pyongyang in recent years. 
					
					 Construction is making brisk headway in other cities of the DPRK.
					
					 Komsomolskaya Pravda on May 13 carried a photo-accompanied article introducing the Masikryong Ski Resort.
					
					 The article introduced in detail the ski resort, noting that enthusiasm for skiing at the resort was running high.
					
					 Touring the resort, many foreigners appreciated it as a world level ski resort, a proof of a highly civilized socialist country.

articles.title: South Koreans' Struggle Backed by British Organizations
articles.content:
South Koreans' Struggle Backed by British Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK released a joint statement on May 15 to mark the 35th anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Kwangju Popular Uprising left a new chapter in the history of struggle of the south Korean people for independence, democracy and national reunification.
					
					 The demonstrators fought bravely against the barbarous suppression by the south Korean puppet group instigated by the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 The uprising clearly proved the truth that freedom and social change never come of themselves and the counterrevolutionary violence must be shattered with revolutionary one.
					
					 Many years have passed since the uprising, but south Korea is still under dark fascist dictatorship.
					
					 Independence and democracy have not yet been materialized in south Korea.
					
					 Another Kwangju Popular Uprising is needed to topple down the Park Geun Hye regime.
					
					 We send full support and solidarity to the south Korean people's struggle to bring down the Park Geun Hye regime and drive the U.S. imperialists, sworn enemy of the Korean nation, out of south Korea.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia de Africa
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia de Africa 
						
Pyongyang, 25 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio este lunes un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente del Comite de la Union Africana, Nkosazana Dlamini-Zuma, con motivo del Dia de Africa.
					La misiva senala que el pueblo coreano desea exitos en los esfuerzos de los pueblos africanos por lograr la integracion politica y economica del continente, consolidar la paz y la estabilidad y alcanzar el desarrollo independiente y la prosperidad. 
					
					Expresa la conviccion de que se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Union Africana y sus miembros.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a Abdullah II
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a Abdullah II 
Pyongyang, 25 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio este lunes un mensaje de felicitacion al rey del Reino Hachemita de Jordania, Abdullah II, con motivo del 69o aniversario de la independencia de este pais. 
					El remitente desea al destinatario buena salud y felicidad y formula votos por mayores exitos en los trabajos del mandatario y pueblo del Reino Hachemita de Jordania por la estabilidad y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: RPDC colabora estrechadamente con UNICEF
articles.content:
RPDC colabora estrechadamente con UNICEF
Pyongyang, 25 de mayo (ACNC) -- La Republica Popular Democratica de Corea promueve activamente las labores para el fomento de salud y la ensenanza a los ninos estrechando la colaboracion con el Fondo de las Naciones Unidas para la Infancia (UNICEF).
					Segun un funcionario interesado, el gobierno de la RPDC hace ingentes esfuerzos para proteger y fomentar la salud de los ninos menores de 5 anos con la asistencia de ese fondo.
					
					Como parte de sus actividades, organiza periodicamente la vacunacion de pentavalente, poliomielitis, sarampion, tuberculosis y otras enfermedades a los ninos de todo el pais.
					
					Suministra a la Casa Maternidad de Pyongyang, el Hospicio de Pyongyang y otros organos de crianza los diferentes tonicos tales como F75, F100, las pildoras de yodo y la vitamina A.
					
					Por otra parte, completo la introduccion de servicio de agua potable por gravedad en varias regiones inclusive las provincias de Hamgyong del Sur, Hwanghae del Sur y Phyong-an del Norte para asegurar siempre el agua limpia a los ninos.
					
					Mientras tanto, el gobierno coopera con el fondo para mejorar el ambiente educacional de los ninos preescolares.
					
					La RPDC concerto el convenio basico con UNICEF el 25 de mayo del 1985 y se incorporo a las actividades de esta organizacion internacional.

articles.title: Emitido en RPDC sello dedicado al 60o aniversario de fundacion de Chongryon
articles.content:
Emitido en RPDC sello dedicado al 60o aniversario de fundacion de Chongryon
Pyongyang, 25 de mayo (ACNC) -- Fue emitido en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea un sello (papel enterizo de pequeno tamano) con motivo del 60o aniversario de la fundacion de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon).
					En su parte superior se ven las letras "Por el 60o aniversario de la fundacion de la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon" y "El 44 (1955) de la Era Juche-el 104 (2015) de la Era Juche".
					
					El sello toma en su fondo la bandera nacional de la RPDC junto con una foto del Presidente Kim Il Sung encontrandose con el presidente del Presidium del Comite Central de la Chongryon, Han Tok Su, y otros funcionarios directivos de esa entidad ultramarina.
					
					Tambien se lee la instruccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un de que los funcionarios de la Chongryon y otros coreanos residentes en Japon deben mantener con firmeza y hacer brillar la idea de los grandes hombres del monte Paektu sin iguales sobre el movimiento autentico de los compatriotas en ultramar y sus indelebles hazanas y hacer todas las labores de acuerdo con la voluntad y el deseo de los Generalisimos.
					
					La Chongryon es una digna entidad de los coreanos en ultramar de la RPDC, fundada el 25 de mayo de 1955 por el Presidente.
